title: Chickpea Salad Bowl (15g)
description: A refreshing and protein-packed vegetarian salad with chickpeas, veggies, and a tangy dressing.
steps: Rinse and drain the boiled chickpeas.
Dice cucumber, tomato, and onion.
In a bowl, mix chickpeas with the chopped veggies.
Drizzle olive oil and lemon juice over the mixture.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Toss well and serve immediately.

title: Paneer Stir-Fry (12.5g)
description: Quick and flavorful Indian-style stir-fried paneer with bell peppers and spices.
steps: Heat oil in a pan and add cumin seeds.
Add paneer cubes and sauté until golden brown.
Add sliced bell peppers and cook for 3-4 mins.
Sprinkle turmeric, red chili powder, and salt.
Mix well and cook until veggies are tender.
Serve hot with roti or rice.

title: Lentil Spinach Soup (18g)
description: A warm and hearty soup made with protein-rich lentils and fresh spinach.
steps: Rinse red lentils thoroughly.
In a pot, sauté garlic and onion in oil.
Add lentils and water, bring to boil.
Simmer for 15-20 minutes until soft.
Add spinach, salt, pepper, and cumin.
Cook for 5 mins and serve warm.

title: Tofu Scramble (20g)
description: A vegan alternative to scrambled eggs, packed with tofu and veggies.
steps: Heat oil in a pan and sauté onion and bell pepper.
Add crumbled tofu and mix well.
Sprinkle turmeric, salt, and pepper.
Cook for 5-6 mins stirring occasionally.
Let the tofu get slightly golden.
Serve with toast or roti.

title: Quinoa Chickpea Bowl (16g)
description: A nutritious grain bowl featuring quinoa, chickpeas, and fresh vegetables.
steps: Layer cooked quinoa in a bowl.
Add chickpeas, carrots, and cucumber.
Top with a dollop of hummus.
Drizzle lemon juice and sprinkle salt.
Mix lightly or keep layered.
Serve fresh for a balanced meal.

title: Greek Yogurt Parfait (20g)
description: A high-protein breakfast or snack with Greek yogurt, granola, and fruits.
steps: Spoon half the yogurt into a glass.
Add a layer of granola and berries.
Repeat with remaining yogurt.
Top with more berries and honey.
Chill for 5 mins if preferred.
Serve as a light meal or snack.

title: Moong Dal Chilla (8g)
description: Indian savory lentil pancakes made from ground moong dal batter.
steps: Soak dal for 2-3 hours and grind to paste.
Add chopped chili, ginger, salt, and turmeric.
Heat a pan and pour ladleful of batter.
Spread gently and drizzle oil on edges.
Cook on both sides till golden.
Serve hot with chutney or curd.

title: Egg White Omelette (23g)
description: A low-fat, high-protein egg white omelette with vegetables.
steps: Whisk egg whites in a bowl.
Add spinach, tomato, salt, and pepper.
Heat oil in a non-stick pan.
Pour mixture and spread evenly.
Cook until firm and flip gently.
Serve hot with toast or salad.

title: Sprouts Stir Fry (10g)
description: Quick stir-fry made with moong sprouts, light spices, and veggies.
steps: Heat oil in a pan and add mustard seeds.
Add onion and sauté until translucent.
Add sprouts and cook for 2-3 minutes.
Add tomato, turmeric, and salt.
Cook until soft but not mushy.
Serve warm as snack or side.

title: Cottage Cheese Sandwich (15g)
description: A protein-rich vegetarian sandwich made with paneer and whole grain bread.
steps: Mix paneer, hung curd, onion, salt, and pepper.
Spread mixture on one slice of bread.
Add mint leaves for flavor.
Cover with the second slice.
Grill or toast until golden.
Serve with ketchup or chutney.

title: Peanut Butter Banana Smoothie (28g)
description: A creamy and high-protein smoothie made with peanut butter, banana, and milk.
steps: Peel and slice the banana.
Add banana, peanut butter, and milk to a blender.
Optionally add cinnamon for flavor.
Blend until smooth and creamy.
Pour into a glass and serve.
Chill beforehand for extra refreshment.

title: Boiled Egg Salad (12.5g)
description: Simple and nutritious salad with boiled eggs and fresh veggies.
steps: Chop the boiled eggs into pieces.
Dice cucumber and tomato.
Mix eggs and veggies in a bowl.
Add salt, pepper, and lemon juice.
Toss gently and combine well.
Serve fresh as a protein-rich snack.

title: Chia Seed Pudding (32g)
description: Overnight pudding with chia seeds soaked in milk, flavored with fruits.
steps: In a jar, mix chia seeds with milk.
Stir well and add honey.
Cover and refrigerate overnight.
Stir again before serving.
Top with chopped fruits.
Serve chilled as breakfast or dessert.

title: Besan Cheela (11g) /Cheela
description: Savory Indian pancakes made with gram flour, veggies, and spices.
steps: Mix besan with chopped veggies and spices.
Add water to form a pourable batter.
Heat a pan and pour batter evenly.
Cook on both sides until golden brown.
Drizzle little oil to crisp edges.
Serve hot with chutney or curd.

title: Masoor Dal with Rice (18g)
description: Classic Indian red lentil curry served with steamed rice.
steps: Wash and boil dal with turmeric and water.
In a pan, sauté cumin, onion, and tomato.
Add boiled dal and adjust salt.
Simmer for 5-7 mins for flavors to blend.
Cook rice separately while dal simmers.
Serve hot dal with steamed rice.

title: Grilled Chicken Skewers (24g) /3 oz
description: Lean grilled chicken chunks marinated in spices and served with vegetables.
steps: Marinate chicken with yogurt, spices, and lemon.
Let sit for at least 30 minutes.
Skewer with bell pepper pieces.
Grill on stove or oven until cooked.
Turn occasionally for even cooking.
Serve with mint chutney or salad.

title: Yashas's famous salad with cheese
description: A fresh and zesty salad with cubes of cheese, olives, cucumbers, and a lemon-herb dressing.
steps: Dice the cucumber, tomato, and red onion.
Cube the cheese (feta for tanginess or paneer for Indian flavor).
In a large bowl, combine all chopped vegetables and cheese.
Add olives, if using.
Drizzle olive oil and lemon juice over the salad.
Season with salt, pepper, and a pinch of oregano, then toss gently and serve chilled.
